title: Nerfing Sejuani is not a good move. Buff the other tank junglers instead
body:
Like seriously, she seems play for like a week and is going to be nerfed already?

Here are the changes :
Sejuani
    Flail of the Northern Winds (W) [Need to look into this one to confirm - I believe the  bonus magic damage might now be 4%/5.5%/7%/8.5%/10% of max health from 4/6/8/10/12%]
    Permafrost (E) base damage increased to 60/95/130/165/200 from 60/90/120/150/180
    Glacial Prison (R ) slow lowered to 30% at all ranks from 90%

The W and E number tweaks mean her DPS is the same or higher end game, while taking away a slight bit of early clear speed. Her net balance is only going to change for people who suck with her ult, other than that this is just a number redistribution, almost a buff even.

They aren't really nerfs. A good Sejuani will not notice the miss slow on ult getting lowered, since you hit the shot more often than not. The W nerf is to tone back her early clear, which was too fast and safe and didn't leave a clear opportunity to punish her. E buff is so that late game you don't even realize the W nerf happened. Riot did exactly what should have been done. They gave her a love tap that keeps bad noob Sejuanis from pub stomping without hurting good Sejuanis at all.
I am very disappointed at this. Just why.
Because players apparently have no idea how to play vs. tank junglers.  It is actually that simple.

The nerfs seem appropriate to me.

W - Reducing the % makes her less effective against other tanks, which makes a lot of sense considering she has some of the best engage so she already does the core job of a tank really well. Why should she also be good at killing other tanks? They didn't go far enough here. They should change it to flat damage instead of % health. She doesn't need % dmg to clear jungle anymore anyway.

E - Whatever doesn't matter. I don't see why they're doing this. Seems like they want to say they're compensating with a power shift but this is so minor that it doesn't count, and she doesn't need compensation anyway.

R - Missing the ult shouldn't 90% slow. Good nerf.

She has really long range engage between her dash and her ult. The enemy frontline has to block her abilities or else she absolutely will stun the backline.

That's the issue though isn't it? If there is no front line and Sej is allowed to get to the squishies, isn't that the other teams fault (or a great job by Sej)? One tank or heavy brusier can block her ult from landing (unlike Amumu). So if she has to Ult and then Q to get to the enemy adc, her damage is going to be lowered. Is this not the idea of "counter play" Riot has been yelling for the past year?

To be fair, she's been picking up traction for a little while now, enough so to be pretty much the only tank jungler to see competitive play in the last few weeks leading up to the Cinderhulk release. These nerfs don't destroy her (in fact, so long as you hit your Ult, the only nerf is to her W), and if a single champion of a class of champions deemed to be complete and utter garbage by pros is suddenly being seen as pick-worthy, something has to be up. Sejuani's situation is reasonably different from the meta shift that's brought Viktor into the spotlight.
But they just buffed a large group of the tank junglers. The fact that Sejuani could build full tank, and also deal an oddly substantial amount of damage warrants a nerf. At least to me.

{{item:3153}} and {{champion:67}} hurt her hard tho. In order to counter Botrk, she needs to prioritize armor and loses out on health, which cuts out her damage.

Tho I really wish they'd just nerf her W and leave her ultimate alone.

I think this is a well-thought-out nerf. It only really hurts if you play Sejuani poorly (missing ults). The W/E tweaks are in opposite directions and so partially offset.

Ult change is good because it punishes somewhat poor usage of her ult. Really, if you hit someone with the slow and then use E, it's pretty much the same effect anyway. 

Her damage against squishy targets isn't really changing much, the W changes mostly impact her clears and ability to fight other tanks. I think reducing her early clears a bit while still maintaining her incredibly strong teamfighting and rewarding good usage of her ult are all good changes. She will still be strong after these changes - they, by no means, dumpster her.
This nerf isn't too big. Her early game is the same and her late game is about the same against squishies. Her R is less rewarding for missing it. Its not too big of a nerf.
